entry.title: The Economic Ripple: Tourism Impact of Rogue Ales’ Closure on Newport, Oregon
entry.summary: The shuttering of Rogue Ales & Spirits has a distinct and severe impact on the local tourism economy of Newport, Oregon, moving beyond just job losses to affect the city’s identity as a destination. 1. Loss of a Major Anchor Attraction Rogue Ales’ flagship brewery and public house on the Newport Bayfront was far more… The post The Economic Ripple: Tourism Impact of Rogue Ales’ Closure on Newport, Oregon appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Case Study: Rogue Ales Closure Signals Crisis in Mid-Tier Craft Brewing
entry.summary: 11/14/2025 NEWPORT, OR – The abrupt closure of Rogue Ales & Spirits, a 37-year veteran and nationally recognized brand, serves as a sharp indicator of the financial rationalization currently sweeping the U.S. craft beer sector. The sudden shutdown of the company’s main Newport brewery and all associated public houses highlights the vulnerability of regional brewers… The post Case Study: Rogue Ales Closure Signals Crisis in Mid-Tier Craft Brewing appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: End of an Era: Rogue Ales Abruptly Closes All Operations, Citing Financial Crisis
entry.summary: Nov 14, 2025 NEWPORT, OR — In a stunning and sudden move that sent shockwaves through the craft beer community, Rogue Ales & Spirits has ceased all operations, effective immediately. The closure, which included the iconic main brewery and public house in Newport, as well as all other pubs across Oregon, reportedly happened without any… The post End of an Era: Rogue Ales Abruptly Closes All Operations, Citing Financial Crisis appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.summary: When Deleta Dickson was younger, her mother Juanita Dickson and aunt Elora Smithey dreamed of opening a restaurant. As the years went on and her mother eventually passed away, the chances of that happening seemingly came and went.

entry.title: Two Eugene Residents Arrested After 73 Pounds of Meth Seized on I-5
entry.summary: Two Eugene residents were arrested after police seized 73 pounds of methamphetamine during a traffic stop on I-5 near Cottage Grove. Investigators say the pair had been transporting drugs from California to Eugene. Additional evidence was found during searches of their homes.

entry.title: Farewell to the Penny: America’s 238-Year-Old Coin Reaches Its End
entry.summary: After 238 years, the U.S. Mint has retired the penny. Officials cite rising production costs as retailers and consumers now face rounding challenges and legal questions over exact change. Existing pennies will remain legal tender as the nation adjusts to life without its oldest coin.

entry.title: Fire Damages Manufactured Home on Brosi Orchard Road in Winston
entry.summary: Fire crews quickly knocked down a blaze that damaged a manufactured home off Brosi Orchard Road in Winston Tuesday evening. All occupants and their dog escaped safely. No injuries were reported, but the cause of the fire remains undetermined due to extensive damage.
